pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.6: “Pastries” renders _pūva_. [Sp.2.233](): Yaṃkiñci paheṇakatthāyāti paṇṇākāratthāya paṭiyattaṃ yaṃkiñci atirasakamodakasakkhalikādi sabbaṃ idha pūvotveva saṅkhyaṃ gacchati, “Whatever is for the purpose of sending away: whatever cake having a superior taste, etc., is prepared as a gift, all that is here counted as _pūva_”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.8: “Baked goods” renders _mantha_. [Sp.2.233](): _Yaṃkiñci pātheyyatthāyāti maggaṃ gacchantānaṃ antarāmaggatthāya paṭiyattaṃ yaṃkiñci baddhasattuabaddhasattutilataṇḍulādi sabbaṃ idha manthotveva saṅkhyaṃ gacchati_, “Whatever provisions for a journey: whatever combined flour and sesame seeds and grains, etc., is prepared for the journey of those traveling, all that is here counted as _mantha_.” This description gives the impression that _mantha_ is a generic term for baked goods.
